page.title: 10ECONOMICS,CHRISTIE & CLAYPON
page.content: Although John Christie was not a farmer he embarked upon an ambitious plan to develop the not vey promising resources of the Great Forest and he invested as greast deal of money in the projects. These fall into three categories: limestone quarrying and coal mining in the Tawe valley(which does not concern us here) and farming. He developed Cnewr as a sheep farm and evidently tried some early experiments in grazing Cheviot sheep on these hills. He also built the Brecon Forest Tramroad intended to transport lime and coal from the Tawe valley to Sennybridge.However the expence of this veture eventually bankrupted him. Ownership of the Crown Allotment there -fore passed to J.Claypon(1788?-1859), a Lincolnshire banker who was the prin -cipal creditor.It was he who complet- ed and ran the Tramroad.
